Voters approved the 1% sales tax for Marion County schools. Salem School District 111 thanks all supporters for investing to make the students and staff safer.
What is the county sales tax for schools?
The County School Facilities Sales Tax allows voters to approve a sales tax to fund school facility needs rather than relying solely on property taxes. The sales tax is for one cent on every dollar spent on qualifying retail purchases. Salem Elementary District No 111 School Board passed a resolution to place the question on the March 17th ballot. The sales tax also now allows it to be used for School Resource Officers and for Mental Health Professionals. As of now, 56 counties in Illinois have said yes to supporting their local schools by passing a 1% sales tax. More information about the county sales tax can be found here.
Salem Elementary can now notify you via text messages of important school announcements. All you have to do is text 'y' to 67587. More information about this opt-in process can be found here.

Salem School District 111 is currently accepting applications for para-professional positions. Anyone who has an associate's degree or has 60 or more college credit hours can obtain a paraprofessional certificate from the Regional Office of Education. The District is also looking for substitute cooks. Anyone interested in the positions should contact the school at 618-548-7702.

hr.article: District Report Card The Illinois report card is released each year to show how the district and schools are performing on a wide range of educational goals. The report card has two main components: the At-a-Glance report card that provides important information about each school or district in a one-page, printable format; and the Online Report Card that delivers in-depth information with explanations of each indicator online.
